results.title: Arctic adventure
results.creator_credit: Tim Bain, Dynamite Entertainment and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: When a bunch of autocratic bears move into the Arctic Circle the lives of its penguin population are instantly and dramatically changed as the region is transformed into a jail-like ‘zoo’. All attempts are being made to break loose whilst young love hangs in the balance and the wily Tek (Kim Gyngell) insists they can fly and escape. But it’s war for Sergeant Pepper (Rod Quantock) who declares “I like the smell of snowballs in the morning” and a battle of wits (or faith) ensues. Voices by: Sigrid Thornton, Eric Bana, Kim Gyngell, Linda Gibson, John Clarke, Rod Quantock, Tim Bain and Adrian Vaughan. Written and directed by Tim Bain.

results.title: ANZACS
results.creator_credit: George Miller, John Dixon, Pino Amenta, Geoff Burrowes, Burrowes Dixon Production Company and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Television series which looks at the ANZAC campaign and the brave soldiers who fought a bloody but hopeless battle in Turkey and wrote thmeselves into a chapter of Australia’s history.

results.title: Anyone can be a genius
results.creator_credit: Julian Russell, Bush Christmas Productions and Channel Communications
results.brief_description: This is a film about the meaning of life, about why the human brain is the most extraordinary thing ever created. Sit back and watch the exploding rocket, the eccentric animation, what it means to be a parent, Land Rights, the re-enactment of Archimedes and listen to the 21 original compositions of music. Or look at Latin America in a way you’ve never seen before. Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst.

results.title: Arafura to Alice
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A film showing life in Darwin, Tennant Creek, Alice Springs, and Ayers Rock in the early 1980’s. This demanding, tough and often inhospitable part of Australia is inhabited by a special type of Australian and is opening up to anyone who is prepared to accept the challenge that the Northern Territory offers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Torrens, Peter Johnson and Film Australia

results.title: Arachnophobia
results.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Richard Vane, Amblin Entertainment and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: A doctor who is deathly afraid of spiders moves his family to a small town where the arachnids are attacking the townspeople. He must overcome his fear to save the community, but it may already be too late! Cast includes Jeff Daniels, Julian Sands, Harley Jane Kozak, John Goodman.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

results.title: Arabella
results.creator_credit: John Cox, John Vernon, BBC-TV and Glyndebourne
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne is renowned for its opera productions and has proven once again, with its choice of Arabella for their Golden Jubilee season, of its high standards and professionalism. A romantic comedy in three acts with music by Richard Strauss and libretto by Hugo von Hofmannsthal, the story of Arabella focuses on a Viennese family, Count Waldner (Artur Korn), his wife Adelaide (Regina Sarfaty) and two daughters, Arabella (Ashley Putnam) and Zdenka (Gianna Rolandi) who live in genteel poverty. Arabella has several suitors but on meeting Mandryka (John Brocheler), a rich landowner, it is love at first sight. Meanwhile Zdenka falls in love with Matteo (Keith Lewis), one of Arabella’s suitors and causes great confusion when she sends Matteo a love letter under Arabella’s name. Intrigue and misunderstanding follow delaying the anticipated happy ending. Strauss’s beautiful waltz music is performed by the London Philharmonic Orchestra, led by David Nolan, conducted by Bernard Haitink, and the Glyndebourne Chorus led by Chorus director Jane Glover. The stylishly authentic stage sets are designed by Julia Trevelyan Oman. Both Ashley Putnam and John Brocheler put in an impressive performance along with their support cast with a special mention to Gwendolyn Bradley in the role of Die Fiakermilli. Produced by BBC Television by arrangement with Glyndebourne in association with RM Arts. Sung in German with no English subtitles. Contains a booklet with both German and English translation.

results.title: Apron strings and atom bombs
results.brief_description: The 50’s were a difficult political time in Australia, mostly due to the Cold War and sense of fear it generated within the community with suspicion directed at Unionists and Communists particularly. It was in this political climate of intolerance that the Union of Australian Women (UAW) was born. Set up primarily to address justice, equal rights and peace, the group were instrumental in specifically targeting: the women’s right to vote; equal pay for equal work; the right to abortion; the right of women to have child care and the fight against conscription. This documentary gathers a group of the founding members of the UAW who share some amusing anecdotes and knowledge that make this oral history a pertinent study of Australia during a politically volatile period.

results.title: Appleseed
results.creator_credit: Kazuyoshi Katayama, Atsushi Sugita, Masaki Sawanobori, Taro Maki and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: A dark, cyberpunk anime set far in the future. World War Three has plunged society into a state of anarchy. To try and resolve the problems created by war, the remaining governments band together to create Olympus, an experimental city designed as a sanctuary for the surviving humanity. However, this new paradise is also home to a new species, the Bio-Droid, a cyborg slave specifically created to administer the city. Some of the citizens are extremely unhappy with this brave new world, and long for liberty - at any price. After terrorists try to destroy the city, special SWAT teams are called in to try and neutralise the situation. Terrorist AJ Sebastian manages to escape from police custody by murdering an officer. Horrified by what has occurred, police offider Dunan Nats and her cyborg partner, Buliaros Hekatonecles, transfer to investigations in order to hunt down and arrest him, before he has the chance to destroy Olympus. A fast-paced anime, filled with heavy weaponry, fascinating mecha, and enough references to characters and places in Greek mythology for the viewer to get a clear sense of the underlying concerns of this animation. This film is based on an original story by Masamune Shirow, who published the first book in the Appleseed series “The Promethean Challenge”, in 1985. In 1986, the Appleseed books won him the Galaxy Award for the best sci-fi manga. In general, Shirow’s inspiration derives from reading extensively, particularly in the areas of science, medicine, the supernatural, military strategy, biology, nanotechnology, and mythology, which is particularly apparent in Appleseed.

results.title: Antz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Eric Darnell, Tim Johnson, Aron Warner, Brad Lewis, Patty Wooton, NBCUniversal and PDI Group
results.brief_description: This dazzling computer animated comedy uses with great comic effect the neurotic persona of Woody Allen in order to tell the story of Z (Allen), a down trodden worker ant struggling to assert his individuality amongst the conformity of the ant colony. Z’s transformation from faceless nobody to unwilling hero eventuates when he volunteers to swap places with his fearless soldier ant buddy Weaver (Sylvester Stallone), in order to get close to the feisty Princess Bala (Sharon Stone). This lands the nervous insect right in the middle of the brutal termite wars and a series of misadventures, accumulating in the search for the mythical “Insectopia”. Directors Eric Darnell and Tim Johnson have a lot of fun by visually suggesting a microscopic world not unlike New York city and by giving the animated ants the physical traits and mannerisms of their voice-over counterparts. Gene Hackman, Dan Aykroyd, Jennifer Lopez, Danny Glover, Christopher Walken and Ann Bancroft are among the many who contribute their voices.
